content: other end st and cinch closed secure with knot but do not cut yarn s t e p 5 s t e p 6 fill open end with polyester fiberfill push tapestry needle with tail yarn through center of closed end through the fiberfill and out the open end 4 © 2020 adrienne sullivan design k n i t i n t h e r o u n d s t e p 7 s t e p 8 weave tail yarn through every other cast on secure with knot trim yarn and weave st and cinch tight both closing the hole and in ends pulling the pumpkin flatter s t e m s t e p 1 s t e p 2 to make i-cord co 4 sts on one dpn slide sts back to beginning of needle do not turn bring yarn behind the work to first st k4 s t e p 3 s t e p 4 repeat until your i-cord is 7 rnds tall cut use remaining tail yarn to sew stem to yarn leaving a 10in long tail thread yarn pumpkin top alternatively affix a twig or through top 4 loops using tapestry needle cinnamon stick using hot glue or sew on a fabric stem 5 © 2020 adrienne sullivan design
